Html:
Hi There,

If you are trying to simulate a mouse button click I'd recommend using the later version of the code which has Mouse simulation.

var sim = new InputSimulator();
sim.Mouse.LeftButtonClick();

Cheers,
Mike

Hi, i absolutely love this library, great work, thank you very much. just wondering where can i download the latest version which has Mouse simulation ? i see only 0.1.00 version available

TIA
Marina
Hi, you need to build the latest version by yourself, just download the source code.

hi, thanks for the quick respond.
is latest version WindowsInput ? should i delete old reference to InputSimulator and replace it with WindowsInput ?
Yes, that is the latest version of the code, it works a little bit different just see the examples

Hi Marina,

You can also use nuget to install the package.

Hope that helps.
Mike

Hi Mike,
When i try to install the package with NuGet i am getting the below error, Please help.


_PM> Install-Package InputSimulator
The source at nuget.org [https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/] is unreachable. Falling back to NuGet Local Cache at C:\Users\myName\AppData\Local\NuGet\Cache
Install-Package : Unable to find package 'InputSimulator'.
At line:1 char:16
  • Install-Package <<<< InputSimulator
    • CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (:) [Install-Package], InvalidOperationException
    • FullyQualifiedErrorId : NuGetCmdletUnhandledException,NuGet.PowerShell.Commands.InstallPackageCommand_
Thanks,
Selvendran P
What nuget is telling you is that it cannot reach the feed at nuget.org so it won't be able to find the InputSimulator package. Perhaps you have a proxy restricting access to nuget.org?
